member.name: D3D12_VIDEO_ENCODER_CODEC_PICTURE_CONTROL_SUPPORT_HEVC
member.summary: Represents picture control support settings for HEVC video encoding.

member.name: D3D12_VIDEO_ENCODER_CODEC_PICTURE_CONTROL_SUPPORT_HEVC.MaxL0ReferencesForP
member.summary: The maximum value allowed in the slice headers for (num_ref_idx_l0_active_minus1 +1) when encoding P frames. This is equivalent to the maximum size of an L0 for a P frame supported.

member.name: D3D12_VIDEO_ENCODER_CODEC_PICTURE_CONTROL_SUPPORT_HEVC.MaxL0ReferencesForB
member.summary: The maximum value allowed in the slice headers for (num_ref_idx_l0_active_minus1 +1) when encoding B frames. This is equivalent to the maximum size of an L0 for a B frame supported.

member.name: D3D12_VIDEO_ENCODER_CODEC_PICTURE_CONTROL_SUPPORT_HEVC.MaxL1ReferencesForB
member.summary: The maximum value allowed in the slice headers for (num_ref_idx_l1_active_minus1 +1) when encoding B frames. This is equivalent to the maximum size of an L1 for a B frame supported.

member.name: D3D12_VIDEO_ENCODER_CODEC_PICTURE_CONTROL_SUPPORT_HEVC.MaxLongTermReferences
member.summary: The maximum number of references used in a frame that can be marked as long term reference.

member.name: D3D12_VIDEO_ENCODER_CODEC_PICTURE_CONTROL_SUPPORT_HEVC.MaxDPBCapacity
member.summary: The maximum number of unique pictures that can be used from the DPB the caller manages (number of unique indices in L0 union L1) for a given command on the underlying hardware.
